channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Sources: project SGLang spins out as RadixArk with $400M valuation as inference market explodes
item.description: SGLang, which originated as an open-source research project at Ion Stoica’s UC Berkeley lab, has raised capital from Accel.

item.title: Blue Origin’s Starlink rival TeraWave promises 6 terabit satellite internet
item.description: SpaceX has the most internet-beaming satellites in its constellation, but the competition is coming, and now Jeff Bezos' space company Blue Origin, has announced the TeraWave network. It says TeraWave will offer bandwidth of up to 6Tb available anywhere on Earth, for both upload and download. The only wrinkle? Even after satellite deployments are scheduled […]...

item.title: RS 275 : le nouveau casque TV Sennheiser qui mise sur l’Auracast pour réinventer l’écoute à domicile
item.description: Sennheiser lance le bundle RS 275 casque TV Auracast pour une écoute privée à la maison. Ce nouveau système associe un casque ultraléger et un transmetteur pour diffuser le son du téléviseur ou d’autres sources sur une large zone et avec une latence voulue pour être quasi imperceptible.

item.title: Bring the Existential Horror of Capitalism to Your Shelf With This ‘Squid Game’ Figure
item.description: Hot Toys' new sixth-scale collectible of Lee Jung-jae's haunted Seong Gi-hun, aka Player 456, comes with a lot of accessories—but you'll have to BYO baby.

item.title: Everyone can hear your TV in their headphones using this transmitter
item.description: As we've previously lamented, one of Bluetooth's best modern features isn't being embraced by the tech world, but that's changing. Sennheiser has announced a new pair of wireless headphones and a transmitter designed for private TV watching that both use a Bluetooth feature called Auracast. Like tuning into a radio station broadcast from a tower, […]...

item.title: Just got a PlayStation Portal? Here are nine games I cannot recommend enough
item.description: Wondering what to play first on your shiny new PlayStation Portal? There’s a world of options thanks to PS Plus, but here’s what I recommend trying first.

item.title: How to watch The Beauty — streaming services, release date and episode schedule
item.description: A seductive drug rewrites beauty, desire, and the horrible cost of perfection. Here’s how you can watch The Beauty online and from anywhere.

item.title: A timeline of the US semiconductor market in 2025
item.description: From leadership changes at legacy semiconductor companies to wishy washy policy around chip exports, a lot happened last year.

item.title: Tough luck, Elon - EPA shuts loophole that lets hyperscalers quickly deploy power generators without needing a permit
item.description: EPA closes loophole allowing temporary gas turbines, forcing hyperscalers to acquire permits and meet federal air quality standards immediately.

item.title: X copies Bluesky with a ‘Starterpacks’ feature that helps you find who to follow
item.description: X says the new feature, similar to Bluesky's Starter Packs, will arrive in the coming weeks.

item.title: Apple Is Reportedly Making Its Own Wearable AI Pin
item.description: The iPhone maker might be preparing to battle OpenAI's own family of AI gadgets.

item.title: Is Star Trek woke?
item.description: Conservative backlash to the latest installment of Star Trek seems to involve not remembering any past installment of Star Trek. Star Trek—a franchise that famously promotes the philosophy “Infinite Diversity in Infinite Combinations”—is being accused of “becoming” too “woke”.

item.title: Todoist’s app now lets you add tasks to your to-do list by speaking to its AI
item.description: The feature, now public, lets you create to-do's and action items by speaking naturally to the app's AI.

item.title: Apple plans to make Siri an AI chatbot, report says
item.description: Siri could look more like ChatGPT than its current state as an integrated feature across Apple products.

item.title: Trump Claims ‘Concept of a Deal’ Reached for Greenland, Says He’ll Cancel New Tariffs
item.description: The president says he "assumes" Denmark knows about the deal.

item.title: Anthropic revises Claude’s ‘Constitution,’ and hints at chatbot consciousness
item.description: The newly revised document offers a roadmap for what Anthropic says is a safer and more helpful chatbot experience.

item.title: Is ‘Masters of the Universe’ Really Going to Do That?
item.description: Nicholas Galitzine stars as He-Man in the upcoming movie, directed by Travis Knight.

item.title: This hi-res music streaming app is rocketing up the charts – and Spotify’s AI ‘Slopify’ outrage could be supplying the fuel
item.description: AI slop is the scourge of music streaming sites, but French platform Qobuz does things differently –and it's being rewarded with huge growth.

item.title: Windows 11's Xbox app arrives on Arm PCs — just in time for Nvidia's rumored debut with its N1X CPU
item.description: Xbox app debuts on Arm PCs as Microsoft boasts that over 85% of Game Pass titles now work with Arm CPUs.

item.title: JLab JBuds Open Headphones Review: How Open Is Too Open?
item.description: (Creed voice) Head-phone wide op-ahn.

item.title: Washington Is Divided on AI Chip Exports as Anthropic CEO Deems China Sales a ‘Mistake’
item.description: Congress might seek more authority over AI chips exports. MAGA can't make up its mind.

item.title: Apple is reportedly working on an AirTag-sized AI wearable
item.description: Apple is working on an AI-powered wearable pin with cameras and microphones designed to pick up a user's surroundings, according to a report from The Information. The rumored device is reportedly the size of an AirTag, with "thin, flat, circular" housing made from aluminium and glass. The Information reports that Apple's rumored AI pin will […]

item.title: Researchers say they convinced Gemini to leak Google Calendar data
item.description: Google's Gemini AI assistant can be coerced into sharing private user calendar data, according to researchers.

item.title: Enfin un vrai chatbot pour Siri ? Apple le lancerait cet automne
item.description: Des années après ses principaux rivaux, Apple lancerait finalement son propre chatbot. Il remplacerait l'interface textuelle actuelle de Siri et permettrait de discuter de tout et de rien, sans oublier de nombreuses autres fonctions inédites pour l'assistant.
